reviews.review_msg: She's great. She puts a tonne of effort into teaching, she makes the subject interesting (and for something that's not super interesting by itself, that's a feat), and she makes herself super available. She has high expectations--it's not easy--but she wants her students to succeed, and will commit herself to helping you understand, if you ask

Hard job to teach a History course, especially when so few people actually care/are interested.  Lectures are thorough, material is... plentiful, but seriously, if you actually nose into it and go get help when you need it, you'll do fine.  She has high expectations - not the least of which being that you work for your grades...

A lot to cover in the course  and the philosophy of science concepts are hard to get your head  around... but Slaney was always available for help and made sure to clarify things on webct discussions throughout the semester. Her course is writing intensive (total of 10+ essays) and you will have to put in work to get a good grade. Textbook optional

Quite rude, condescending, and unhelpful. Lots of definitions and names to remember. I have never found any of the material I learned in this class helpful for any of my future courses. She should test concepts more than rote memory but does not. I would recommend you avoid this class but you cannot if you want a Psyc major. Good luck!

She tried her best to make the stuff less boring. As long as you work hard, you will get pretty high mark onb them. The mid term is hard bcuz you have to memorize all the definitions. However, she promised she will not do this agian on final.
she is okay but there is too much to read

Probably the worst in the dept. She knows we have to take her class to get a psyc BA, so she thinks she can get away with being pretentious and rude. Notes are confusing on purpose, must be very hard for ESL students! Rude to everyone. Impossible to listen to her or to 'decode' lecture notes. Gives extra work just for fun & only marks part of it!

I think that she can be quite rude, harsh and doesn't really seem to want to be there, but I think her teaching ability is ok,she knows the material well, and her exam was very fair. It's hard to make this stuff interesting, but I think she does not a bad job. I guess she could just be a little warmer.

also, two of the questions on the midterm were basically identical to the questions that were in assignment 2, so you should've already known how to answer those. i agree that the material is boring, although i have hope for the second half of the course. you get what you put into the course. the midterm honestly was not as bad as people make it ou

so i've changed my opinion of this class since the midterm, for the better actually. reading other people's comments on here had me worried, but the midterm was not that hard at all, i did better than i expected, i mean she gives you the essay question in advance. what are you all whining about? you don't even need to read the textbook

Entertaining? Are you having a wack attack? I find it literally painfully difficult to be entertained by a professor who READS her lectures from a pile of notes. Also don't rely on the TEXT BOOK of all things to answer the written assignments, you're setting yourself up for failure. Avoid this prof - if that's what you wanna call her.

When I took her class, the class average for the midterm was something like 30%! Most people in the class did horribly! Her ability to teach is mediocre, but it's the difficult exams that really mess you up! I don't know if she's better now, but I would definitely not take a class with her again EVER!!

Honestly, I don't know why people complained so much about her. I took this class in the fall of 2006, and basically you just had to memorize the notes, you did not have to know the text. The reason why so many people complained I guess was cuz it was a lot of notes but what do you expect from a history class?

I went in to this class with the lowest of expectations, but finished this course with a fairly positive impression of the prof. The midterm and final are crazy difficult, but she managed expectations better this semester by essentially saying she marks on a curve. What also surprised me is that she is an excellent speaker. Clear and entertaining.

This woman is a real piece of work!! She's grumpy, pretentious, and pety. In all my years of education I've never encountered such lack of professionalism. I'd sooner be taught psychology by a group of sem-retarded monkeys rather than sit through another one of her classes.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

all i can say this professor is not professional at all.  she does not care how much you understanding.  she only knows non-stop talking as fast as she can to go through all the materials.  she was thinking not to record lecture from the beginning, but, dep force her to. (lots of people throwing their pencils and drop off the class on the 1st day

Very difficult and frustrating course. Over 200 definitions to memorize and know the person or school associated with them for the exam as well as three essays to practice before the final and 70 multiple choice questions. Crazy! Really low average. Not very friendly, helpful or understanding.

Dr.Slaney was very knowledgeable about this subject, however tried to teach us WAY too much information with way too much detail, especially for a 2nd year course. If you want to learn how to work your ass off take this course however don't expect to do above average, and be prepared to study like you never have B4. VERY hard exams, but easy paper.
if u want to fail the course, take her; if u want to feel frustrated, take her;  if u want to waste money, take her, if u don't want to graduate, take her. I never seen such a ... prof like her.
Just plain rude to the students.  What's the point in that?

Like someone said above, exam average was 50%.  She likes to read paragraphs of information during lecture instead of focusing on trying to teach you what you need to know for the course.  Maybe it's just cause I don't like history courses.
what does it tell you when the average on the midterm is 50%?  brutal.
Her exam seemed to be pretty hard.  At the end of the exam, I expected her to come out dressed as Gandalf and yell "YOU SHALL NOT PASS".
Her exams are not too hard if you have a good memory and be able to express all the material she has covered in class.
Messy writing, talks too fast, textbook is absolute crap - too detailed, confusing, unnecessary fancy writing.
Jarkko is one of my favorite profs. He is intelligent, open-minded yet very humble. He has amazing public speaking skills, with short & sweet intriguing tangents.

hands down, prof JJ is one of the best profs i've ever had in my 7 semesters here at sfu. i hate taking history courses but psyc207 turned out to be fun, enjoyable, and totally worthwhile -- and i took it during intersession! he's funny, he's smart, he's spontaneous, he's a great teacher. period. oh, and he's totally a fox too. ;-) (is he retired?)

Jarkko is awesome!! i didn't expect i will enjoy this class but it turns out that it was one of the best class i've every had. He is definitely knowlegeable and fun. The text was hard but i managed to get a B without reading the text but focused on his and the ta's notes.

Amazing professor; one of the best I've ever had.  He's so passionate about his work that it inspires myself and others.  He took a boring class and made it one of my favourites.  You won't miss a class because his lectures are so interesting.  The text book sucks, but if you take notes and go to tutorials you'll do well.

The midterm was difficult but the final exam was a breeze. Attend all lectures-tutorial seemed to be a waste of time. The textbook was awful so make use of TA notes. However, sometimes the notes the TA supplied weren't that helpful. This was one of my least favourite Psychology courses that I have taken.

I was surprized by how interesting this class was!!! I thought it would be boring but it's not.  Great lectures and tutorials!!! Don't bother with the text.  Make GOOD notes, study from those and don't miss a lecture.
Makes the class fun with his jokes, and he explains things very well.
Organization could use some work, but he is obviously brilliant. I'd like to see him fight with Mark Blair. Perferably it a battle of wits. Tests and assignments were fair.
one of the best psyc classes at sfu in regards to the prof, tutorials, and textbook. jalva really cares about what he is teaching which is refreshing.
He explains everything very logically and clearly.  He made the course material interesting with his wit and examples.
Very clear & friendly. Seems to know what he's talking about & is a fiar grader

I just took the intersession course with him. difficult textbook, but great lectures (very helpful & somewhat clear); the pace was very fast, especially after the midterm. He's a nice guy, and it's great to have him for psyc 207. :)

He is adorable, he definitely loves teaching. He is always there for help. Test materials are base on MC short ans and Essay..not hard at all if you understand all the materials.  Interssession class weren't hard at all. He repeat himself often so students can remember it for exams. He is a great professor. Waiting for him to teach 307 next summer

Obviously loves what he teaches.  Exams are pretty simple.  Take good notes and study them because that's the majority of the tests.  He's funny and makes what could be a really horrible class into something that's tolerable.

He's a very good teacher, clear, and eager to help.  Ive never had a class go so slow because he wants everyone to understand what he's talking about.  That being said however the book is, in a word, painful.

Don't get scared when you see him - he may seem intimidating and boring, but in reality, he makes a boring historical material sound interesting - I didn't miss any lecture - and you can't really cuz he doesnt post anything online. Prepare to listen(text is full of useless bs and won't help you much

He has a good sense of humour but not a very good lecturer. You can pretty much completely ignore the textbook for this class. Can be a bit boring sometimes. He likes to concentrate on the stories instead of the facts, which can make it interesting and easier to remember. Decent prof.
MMM. He's great. Charming indeed.

I have only heard him read one(first)lecture and was shocked by how boring it was. He said so much bs and nonsense that my ears started to hurt. I could not wait until the end and left earlier. But the comments on this site make me want to attend another lecture just to make sure.(BenStiller+monkey)
No Comments

I HATE History classes and he made his class one of my favorites @ SFU. He is just a great teacher with an awesome sense of humour. People say he is hard but if you pay attention in class and follow his lecture notes you'll do awesome!!
Great sense of humour. He obviously enjoys teaching and makes the otherwise dry material relevent and interesting. I wish he was teaching more than one course

Pretty straight forward class. Go to lectures, take good notes & read the boring text, and you'll do fine on the tests. Tutorials are a waste of time, but have to go to get participation marks. Overall, not a bad class, Jarko makes it enjoyable due to his humor and teaching style; He's a good prof.
he is a very clear and charming TEACHER. I can tell that he takes teaching seriously. Very humerous as well. He made this class interesting.
Really cares about the students. Very helpful and understanding. Made the course as interesting as was possible.
Loved the course!! His teaching style is clear, and concise, and he is entertaining to say the least. Exams are fair, and marked well.
He is not clear and he does not make the class very interesting.
Great guy and makes class funny... but he is not very clear in presenting the information and he gives hardly any notes to study from.
boring class, but he tries his best.
One of the best PSYC prof ;) and a great guy too!
he makes everything clear...the text really sucks
Funny.
Exams are easy, no tricky questions, essay gave you ahead of time.  Lectures are interesting.  And he is a nice guy.
No Comments
not very clear
He's funny and interesting and makes a boring subject fun. He's nice to look at as well :)
isn't very clear but is interesting... sometimes... horrible class nonetheless
fascinating + enlightening lectures! funny too ;)
adds his own spin... makes a really icky subject a little less icky
No Comments

A decent teacher. Spoke much too slowly, however, and classes ended up taking twice as long as necessary. His tests were reasonable, with a few exceptions. Too many "none of the above" mc/ questions were ambiguous, and the essay question in the final was truly incomprehensible. It didn't even make gramatical or conceptual sense.

he is a nice guys who makes that course very easy, his exam includes mc and short questions but mainly focuses on the lecture notes (about 80%). for the eassy, he is cocusing on your effort, because no matter your argument is right or wrong, as long as you find proper quotes to support your idea, you will be fine.the eassy is more like free writing
very helpful, very clear and approachable. easy on the eyes too!
Great prof! Pay most attention to lectures and take great notes - most questions on exams are from there. Very helpful and dedicated to students.
No Comments
No Comments
Midterms straightfoward, fairly easy class

Although he's clearly passionate about the subject matter, Jack makes the content seem more uninteresting and boring than he should have. The bullet points in his lecture slides are essays, which is extremely off-putting and discouraging. The exams were quite fair... just make sure you know your stuff!

Jack really knows a lot about his field, but his lectures seem disorganized and confusing. Study his lecture notes only, exams are entirely based off lecture material. Videos waste time and are not testable. Final assignment is abstract and requires covering too much unrelated material.

great lecturer! only test on materials in lecture & textbook... so if not in either or, its not testable... makes the most boring thing interesting... its not tat easy to get a great mark on the exams but its decent...  exams are not cumulative!

I enjoyed this class. Despite his tendency to be slightly awkward, it does come across that Jack is interested in the topic he teaches. The final and midterm had a dozen or so questions and were worth around 30% each, which I found somewhat irritating. Nevertheless, his lectures were effective at attempting to address such a broad topic.

To be fair, he's a decent prof and pretty nice guy but sometimes he does tend to tangent on random things. Furthermore, he is like an energizer bunny in that he keeps going for a long time. Exams are fair but not super easy. The key is to exclusively study slides and if you don't understand then read book. Ended up being better than I expected.
I think his lectures are very entertaining and he does not have a monotonous voice. I guess one must love the subject to appreciate his passion for it. Love this class!
not a bad teacher, lecture can be boring and dry
Jack is a wonderful lecturer. He is knowledgeable, approachable, and helpful. The exams are fair...there is no need to memorize the nitty gritty details.

I truly enjoyed attending lecture. The material can be a bit dry because it is history but he makes it engaging. The exams were fair, all written so you have to know your stuff. If you take good notes during lecture and study off of them for the exams you should do fine. Just use the text for extra reading and understanding.

It's too bad the material is so dry. Jack's not a bad prof, but there's a lot of material and it's just really boring stuff. Good things about this class is there's no paper (12 1 page responses to the week's lecture that are pass/fail) and the exams are fair. I heard the last prof to teach this class was a witch so if you can take with Jack,do it.

Material is so boring, and Jack's lectures are not very exciting. I do sympathize with him because I can't imagine any way to make this stuff interesting. No multiple choice on exams, all short answers, but most of the questions are fair.
